markdownRemark.html:
No, I haven’t moved physically. Rather, I’ve moved my blog. My first blog, coffee. code. cedric, was hosted on Medium when that was the cool thing to do. I even had a custom domain for my publication before that feature was steamrolled.

To be honest, I really struggled with keeping the blog up-to-date. It felt like every new post I would start off by saying, “I know this is long overdue, but from now on, I’m going to start writing a post every x amount of time” which turned out to never be true. Not only that, I felt as though I had limited myself in the number of topics I could write about since the original blog was targeted at programming and Computer Science.

Thus, when my old domain expired and the link to my Medium publication broke, I decided not to fix it and instead told myself that I will host my own blog. Along with that, I also made the decision to not limit myself in the type of content I write about. So, I’m telling myself and you now that anything goes, be it related to: programming, philosophy, design — whatever.

  • Why the move

    • wanting to take ownership of my content
    • try some new tech (Gatsby.js)
    • many of my favorite bloggers host their own blog

  • Focus of this blog?

    • gonna say anything goes (philosophical, programming, design, etc.)
    • at the moment, no target audience (not trying to grow a mailing list); really want to just improve my writing by doing it more often
